# SABINE-CLASS SALVAGE SHUTTLE
[color=#a4885c]Ship Size:[/color] Small
[color=#a4885c]Recommended Crew:[/color] 1-2

"A small, light, 2 seater salvage shuttle for light mining operations. Usually found as part of a fleet or carrier group."
# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the SMES unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the substation unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the main APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check the APC unit's current Load* (W).
## 1.2. S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit.
- Check that the generator unit is properly anchored. - Check that the generator unit is connected to the cable terminal of your SMES via HV. - Check the fuel remaining of the generator unit. - Set the generator unit output power to 22 kW. - Enable Injection.
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Ensure that a air canister is wrenched to the connector port. - Check that the air canister is of a suitable atmos mixture (~22% oxygen, ~78% nitrogen). - Enable the gas pump into the distribution system.
## 2.2. Waste Loop
- Enable waste loop pump.
## 3. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled.
## Sidenotes
* - Sabine-class salvage shuttles are equipped with one APC unit that can be used to appraise the ship's total power consumption. Unmodified Sabine-class ship requires ~21.25 kW of power to remain operational.
